summary: Wow. Unbelievable. The absolute reach to come to such a conclusion about a character who throughout the series showcases his...
body:
Wow. Unbelievable. The absolute reach to come to such a conclusion about a character who throughout the series showcases his wisdom and kindheartedness towards others.

I think this show is too much for some. They clearly don’t understand the story nor the character developments and journeys of different characters. They’re so in denial to the point were now everyone is an enemy. Including the actors themselves (Sophie/maisie etc). They can’t even differentiate the actors from their characters.

summary: FYI: Jon and Sansa have been having “tension” since season 6 and long before Dany ever came into the picture. Her presence in...
body:
FYI: Jon and Sansa have been having “tension” since season 6 and long before Dany ever came into the picture. Her presence in Winterfell only amplifies the tension that already existed between Sansa and Jon.

This tells you two things:

  1. The tension between Jon and Sansa is bigger than Sansa just “being upset” with Jon for bringing Dany up North. Dany obviously plays a part but clearly whatever “issue” that’s between Jon and Sansa has been brewing since season 6 and Dany is neither the core problem or the core resolution for the tension to finally be resolved in season 8! *Bonus: Arya siding with Sansa also establishes that once again the tension between Jon and Sansa is not a political/power struggle. If that was the case ARYA WOULD NOT BE ON SANSA’S SIDE! We have already seen this storyline playout in season 7 when she suspected Sansa of making power plays against Jon when clearly that wasn’t the case. This makes this excuse no longer valid and shifts the root of their tension to something else.
  2. The tension between Jon and Sansa is so important that they’ve drawn it out for over 3 seasons and are clearly using Dany as a catalyst to bring everything to a head. The show is teasing Sansa vs Dany with Jon in the middle when in reality it’s Jon and Sansa “tension” with Dany caught in the middle of a pot that’s already been stirred. That’s why so many people jumped on the “Sansa is going to betray Jon ship” because people are recognizing and mischaracterizing the tension that has been well established between Jon and Sansa and HAS YET TO BE RESOLVED!!!

This is the key folks!! At this point, even Sansa and Arya have resolved their issues and seemingly are on the same page so what’s the deal with Jon and Sansa? Why haven’t they sorted their shit out yet?! Why is their tension an important plot of the show? These are the questions that need to be considered and ultimately will drive the show forward!

summary: Fonte do Game of Thrones traz show de efeitos inspirados na série
title: Fonte do Game of Thrones traz show de efeitos inspirados na série
body:
Fonte do Game of Thrones traz show de efeitos inspirados na série

Como celebração do lançamento da última temporada, fizeram uma fonte do Game of Thrones totalmente tematizada com o seriado.

O show começa todos os dias às 21:30 e vai até 13 de abril nas Fontes de Bellagio, em Las Vegas, e traz a música tema da produção da HBO com imagens inspiradas na série, além da água que se move em diversas direções.

Confira.

A fonte do Game of Thrones

View On WordPress

body:
Out of This World II

part one HERE

word count: 1.4k

warning: SPOILERS!! A curse here and there

note: COMMENT TO BE ADDED TO THE TAGLIST <3

▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰

Even though you were afraid to sleep in fear that you’d return home, you couldn’t help it once you were left in your new chambers. The exhaustion won and you fell asleep in the surprising comfortable bed.

All fears went away when you woke up in the same soft furs you had fallen asleep in.

The brief fear of being stuck in Westeros forever crossed your mind, but the thought of leaving you scared you more.

The unfamiliar bedroom had a chill to it and the classic North gloom you remember from TV. The only light was coming from the window and even then it was overcast out.

After waking, Catelyn Stark helped you and quickly trusted you. Honestly, if anyone were to find you out it’d be here. She gave you a dress and took you to Maester Luwin, who of course couldn’t aid with your memory loss. Weeks passed, when you had no sign of regaining your memory and there was no word of any house looking for a missing lady, the Starks took you indefinitely.

Everyday was an adventure for you. Each Stark child kept you entertained in one way or another. You practiced sword fighting with Robb, you attempted archery with Jon, you learned pinpoint with Sansa, you caused trouble with Arya, even played games with Bran and Rickon.

You loved them all.

That’s why it was so frustrating that you couldn’t tell them their fate.

Everytime you attempted to spoil something of the future the words would die in your throat. An invisible force always stopping you.

You learned of this when one day you were sitting in a comfortable silence with Jon and you decided to bring up the idea that he wasn’t a bastard. A very important factor in his fate.

“What if you weren’t a bastard?” Is what you were going to lead with, but all that escaped was cough. You tried again and still remained sputtering. The only thing you successfully did was scare Jon who was patting your back in worriment.

Even when you tried to curve around the invisible force, it seemed as if the world knew your motives.

Your second attempt was with Robb when he informed you the King was on his way to Winterfell.

“Your father mustn’t go to capital.” It wasn’t a direct statement, but still it never was aired. You were desperate and scared for them. You knew their fate and you didn’t want to have experience it, but now you had front row seats to their doom.

Only then did you wish to go home.

That’s how you ended up standing behind the Stark family as the King arrived. You almost didn’t notice everyone bowing when he stepped out, so you quickly copied everyone else.

“You got fat.” You heard Robert Baratheon bellow out at Ned, who just gave him a pointed look. It was strange to see what you had already watched several times in person. It gave you a whole new point of view. The whole feeling was surreal. The fact that you weren’t limited to just what the camera captured was amazing.

You glanced around as everyone rised. You saw the upset Cersei watching Robert and Ned walked into the crypts, Jaime in his golden armor dismount his horse, Myrcella and Tommen run off with Arya and Bran, Joffrey whisper something to his mother before briskly walking off, and that’s when you eyes landed on him.

Following Joffrey was no other than the Hound.

He was tall and intimidating. You then understood why everyone seemed so wary of him, but even so your curiosity remained. You knew he wasn’t a villain, by no means was he a hero, but he was a good person.

As if he could feel eyes on him he turned towards you. You made direct eye contact and it felt like a jolt of electricity went through you. He glowered at you no doubt expecting a fearful expression in return, but you only offered a polite smile in return. You knew what he looked like, so you weren’t taken aback by his scarred face. You knew your reaction took him off guard, judging from his confused expression.

Before anymore looks could be exchanged he continued with his task of following the Prince.

A hand gripped your arm and dragged you away and inside.

“Did you see him?” Sansa sang out excitedly.

“The Hound?” You replied without stopping to think.

“What? No!” Sansa gave you a horrified look before continuing, “The Prince! Heavens, he was so handsome! I think we’re going to be betrothed.”

There were a millions things you wanted to tell Sansa, to warn Sansa, but the only one that was deemed appropriate by the forces was, “Be careful.” You sighed. You wanted to tell her, run away Joffrey is a psycho! You definitely don’t want to be with that monster. But of course, you couldn’t.

“Careful?” She just laughed it off before going off about what beautiful children they’d have.

Luckily, Jon decided to save you.

“Lady Y/N, would you mind taking a walk with me?” He asked and Sansa seemed to bristle at his presence, quickly excusing herself. Even though no one knew if you were a “Lady” or not, everyone in Winterfell always addressed you as such. Of course there were a couple of critics. Some were convinced you were a lying whore that desperate for a better life, other theories believed you were going to kill Ned Stark.

The Starks ignored them all, putting their trust in you. Although none of those theories were correct, you still felt slightly guilty.

“I don’t mind at all.” You smiled and walked back outside, watching the servants unload the carriages. Jon was probably the person you were closest to here. You never saw him as a bastard and he appreciated the kind treatment.

“Do you really think they need all that stuff?” Jon asked, breaking the silence and making you laugh.

“Definitely not,” You smiled, but quickly lost it before a thought crossed your mind, “Jon, why couldn’t you greet the King and Queen with the others?”

“Because it’d be rude for a bastard to be present…” He trailed off, his usual moody expression making its appearance.

“Well, that’s bullshit!” You cussed causing the boy next you to loss it with laughter.

“Should a Lady like you be swearing?” A gruff voice took you and Jon both off guard as you turned and saw the Hound.

Sandor Clegane, you corrected yourself. He was more than Joffrey’s dog.

“Bold to assume I’m a Lady.” You chimed back and Sandor met your gaze head on. You made sure there was no fear or judgement in your gaze.

The realization surprised Sandor.

He quickly studied you and took in your words. He only knew you were close to the Starks, but other than that he had no idea of who you were. But here you were looking at him like you could see right through him. In all honesty, you terrified him right away.

The spell was broken once more by Jon, who was set on dragging you away from the man.

“What was that?” Jon asked immediately after being out of earshot.

“What was what?” You questioned back, genuinely not taking the hint.

“The Hound makes even me want to run away, but you seemed to be undressing him with your eyes!” He said just a little too loudly causing you to hit him and choke on air.

“I was not!” Your cheeks burned.

“Was too!”

“What’s with the childish bickering?” Robb walked around the corner and you quickly glared at Jon to keep quiet.

“Y/N is lovesick for the Hound.” Jon traitorously told Robb and you hit him again.

“Jon is a liar! And is too embarrassed to admit he can’t fall asleep workout fire light!” You hissed back.

“You promised not to tell anyone that!” He sputtered, but you only scowled.

“Well, if your this worked up about it maybe Jon is telling the truth?” Robb began to tease right as Theon approached. Knowing if Theon heard wind of this the whole castle would as well, so quickly you departed, leaving the two boys laughing behind you.

You didn’t have a crush on Sandor? You didn’t know him. Well, maybe you did considering you watched him on TV, but not personally. You never thought he was ugly when watching the show, but you never fangirled over him or anything. Seeing him in person is just overwhelming you told yourself. Even after telling yourself over and over that you didn’t have a crush, your heart still didn’t slow down.

You glimpsed the sight of him following Joffrey once more and you couldn’t help whisper,

“Shit.”

PART THREE

taglist~ @ignoranttruly @your-new-mom @buck-me-up-barnes

You never thought he was ugly when watching the show, but you never fangirled over him or anything. Seeing him in person is just overwhelming you told yourself. Even after telling yourself over and over that you didn’t have a crush, your heart still didn’t slow down.

You glimpsed the sight of him following Joffrey once more and you couldn’t help whisper,

“Shit.”

PART THREE

taglist~ @ignoranttruly @your-new-mom @buck-me-up-barnes

trail.content_raw:
Out of This World II

part one HERE

word count: 1.4k

warning: SPOILERS!! A curse here and there

note: COMMENT TO BE ADDED TO THE TAGLIST <3

▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰▰

Even though you were afraid to sleep in fear that you’d return home, you couldn’t help it once you were left in your new chambers. The exhaustion won and you fell asleep in the surprising comfortable bed.

All fears went away when you woke up in the same soft furs you had fallen asleep in.

The brief fear of being stuck in Westeros forever crossed your mind, but the thought of leaving you scared you more.

The unfamiliar bedroom had a chill to it and the classic North gloom you remember from TV. The only light was coming from the window and even then it was overcast out.

After waking, Catelyn Stark helped you and quickly trusted you. Honestly, if anyone were to find you out it’d be here. She gave you a dress and took you to Maester Luwin, who of course couldn’t aid with your memory loss. Weeks passed, when you had no sign of regaining your memory and there was no word of any house looking for a missing lady, the Starks took you indefinitely.

Everyday was an adventure for you. Each Stark child kept you entertained in one way or another. You practiced sword fighting with Robb, you attempted archery with Jon, you learned pinpoint with Sansa, you caused trouble with Arya, even played games with Bran and Rickon.

You loved them all.

That’s why it was so frustrating that you couldn’t tell them their fate.

Everytime you attempted to spoil something of the future the words would die in your throat. An invisible force always stopping you.

You learned of this when one day you were sitting in a comfortable silence with Jon and you decided to bring up the idea that he wasn’t a bastard. A very important factor in his fate.

“What if you weren’t a bastard?” Is what you were going to lead with, but all that escaped was cough. You tried again and still remained sputtering. The only thing you successfully did was scare Jon who was patting your back in worriment.

Even when you tried to curve around the invisible force, it seemed as if the world knew your motives.

Your second attempt was with Robb when he informed you the King was on his way to Winterfell.

“Your father mustn’t go to capital.” It wasn’t a direct statement, but still it never was aired. You were desperate and scared for them. You knew their fate and you didn’t want to have experience it, but now you had front row seats to their doom.

Only then did you wish to go home.

That’s how you ended up standing behind the Stark family as the King arrived. You almost didn’t notice everyone bowing when he stepped out, so you quickly copied everyone else.

“You got fat.” You heard Robert Baratheon bellow out at Ned, who just gave him a pointed look. It was strange to see what you had already watched several times in person. It gave you a whole new point of view. The whole feeling was surreal. The fact that you weren’t limited to just what the camera captured was amazing.

You glanced around as everyone rised. You saw the upset Cersei watching Robert and Ned walked into the crypts, Jaime in his golden armor dismount his horse, Myrcella and Tommen run off with Arya and Bran, Joffrey whisper something to his mother before briskly walking off, and that’s when you eyes landed on him.

Following Joffrey was no other than the Hound.

He was tall and intimidating. You then understood why everyone seemed so wary of him, but even so your curiosity remained. You knew he wasn’t a villain, by no means was he a hero, but he was a good person.

As if he could feel eyes on him he turned towards you. You made direct eye contact and it felt like a jolt of electricity went through you. He glowered at you no doubt expecting a fearful expression in return, but you only offered a polite smile in return. You knew what he looked like, so you weren’t taken aback by his scarred face. You knew your reaction took him off guard, judging from his confused expression.

Before anymore looks could be exchanged he continued with his task of following the Prince.

A hand gripped your arm and dragged you away and inside.

“Did you see him?” Sansa sang out excitedly.

“The Hound?” You replied without stopping to think.

“What? No!” Sansa gave you a horrified look before continuing, “The Prince! Heavens, he was so handsome! I think we’re going to be betrothed.”

There were a millions things you wanted to tell Sansa, to warn Sansa, but the only one that was deemed appropriate by the forces was, “Be careful.” You sighed. You wanted to tell her, run away Joffrey is a psycho! You definitely don’t want to be with that monster. But of course, you couldn’t.

“Careful?” She just laughed it off before going off about what beautiful children they’d have.

Luckily, Jon decided to save you.

“Lady Y/N, would you mind taking a walk with me?” He asked and Sansa seemed to bristle at his presence, quickly excusing herself. Even though no one knew if you were a “Lady” or not, everyone in Winterfell always addressed you as such. Of course there were a couple of critics. Some were convinced you were a lying whore that desperate for a better life, other theories believed you were going to kill Ned Stark.

The Starks ignored them all, putting their trust in you. Although none of those theories were correct, you still felt slightly guilty.

“I don’t mind at all.” You smiled and walked back outside, watching the servants unload the carriages. Jon was probably the person you were closest to here. You never saw him as a bastard and he appreciated the kind treatment.

“Do you really think they need all that stuff?” Jon asked, breaking the silence and making you laugh.

“Definitely not,” You smiled, but quickly lost it before a thought crossed your mind, “Jon, why couldn’t you greet the King and Queen with the others?”

“Because it’d be rude for a bastard to be present…” He trailed off, his usual moody expression making its appearance.

“Well, that’s bullshit!” You cussed causing the boy next you to loss it with laughter.

“Should a Lady like you be swearing?” A gruff voice took you and Jon both off guard as you turned and saw the Hound.

Sandor Clegane, you corrected yourself. He was more than Joffrey’s dog.

“Bold to assume I’m a Lady.” You chimed back and Sandor met your gaze head on. You made sure there was no fear or judgement in your gaze.

The realization surprised Sandor.

He quickly studied you and took in your words. He only knew you were close to the Starks, but other than that he had no idea of who you were. But here you were looking at him like you could see right through him. In all honesty, you terrified him right away.

The spell was broken once more by Jon, who was set on dragging you away from the man.

“What was that?” Jon asked immediately after being out of earshot.

“What was what?” You questioned back, genuinely not taking the hint.

“The Hound makes even me want to run away, but you seemed to be undressing him with your eyes!” He said just a little too loudly causing you to hit him and choke on air.

“I was not!” Your cheeks burned.

“Was too!”

“What’s with the childish bickering?” Robb walked around the corner and you quickly glared at Jon to keep quiet.

“Y/N is lovesick for the Hound.” Jon traitorously told Robb and you hit him again.

“Jon is a liar! And is too embarrassed to admit he can’t fall asleep workout fire light!” You hissed back.

“You promised not to tell anyone that!” He sputtered, but you only scowled.

“Well, if your this worked up about it maybe Jon is telling the truth?” Robb began to tease right as Theon approached. Knowing if Theon heard wind of this the whole castle would as well, so quickly you departed, leaving the two boys laughing behind you.

You didn’t have a crush on Sandor? You didn’t know him. Well, maybe you did considering you watched him on TV, but not personally. You never thought he was ugly when watching the show, but you never fangirled over him or anything. Seeing him in person is just overwhelming you told yourself. Even after telling yourself over and over that you didn’t have a crush, your heart still didn’t slow down.

You glimpsed the sight of him following Joffrey once more and you couldn’t help whisper,

“Shit.”

PART THREE

taglist~ @ignoranttruly @your-new-mom @buck-me-up-barnes

blog.name: adoseofrefinement
blog.description: this blog will be a place where i post what i want. tv shows, movies, PSD's... anything that makes me happy. call me timia | gif requests are open |

title: What in the world lol.
body:
Why do people ship Jonerys OR Jonsa? Those tags are literally so crazy.

Danerys is literally A QUEEN who has conquered so much stuff and I love her. But Jon is her nephew. Imo they shouldn’t even have a  “love story”. I feel like she deserves to rule on her own or find a man who isn’t related to her. Especially who isn’t her brothers son lol. I saw someone say that “Jonerys is okay because dany doesn’t know” somewhere which is hilarious lol. But at the same time, I believe incest is normal in her family so who knows, she’ll probably be okay with it.

Sansa has also been through a lot but has always come out on top. But ya’ll, c’mon now be serious. Sansa does not want to bang her brother lmao. Even if they aren’t siblings, they were still raised that way and they weren’t even close until the most recent seasons. I’ve watched all the scenes of them together multiple times and the only vibe i get from them is a sister loving her brother.

I definitely, 1000000% believe that Jonsa will not happen. However i’m iffy with Jonerys because even though Kit said that Jon isn’t like that, the show has been pushing their “romance” hard on us. I hope that they keep those ships from happening and let these women find actual people they can love because I honestly don’t see Jon willingly wanting to be with someone he knows he’s related to.

description:
On a first date, you eat, talk, and maybe watch a movie. You don’t beat the tar out of each other.
Nobody seemed to have informed Jaime’s date of that.

summary: So Dany really just 'Jon hop on dragon and let's go to fuck somewhere'. What the fucked up fanservice is it? lol and Jon after...
question: So Dany really just 'Jon hop on dragon and let's go to fuck somewhere'. What the fucked up fanservice is it? lol and Jon after 'you ruined horses for me'. I can't. It's lmao
answer:
She barely spent time with him but he gets on a dragon without prompting, she never even offered Missandei a ride on Drogon. Dany… I can’t even blame her pussy for leading her astray because their sex scene was so bad. Girl what are you thinking?

Also ‘you ruined horses for me’ is so hilarious and cheesy and yuck but it’s the most romantic thing they have both said to each other. ‘OTP: you ruined horses for me’ lmaooooooooo this is apparently the grand romance of the series

Also ‘you ruined horses for me’ is so hilarious and cheesy and yuck but it’s the most romantic thing they have both said to each other. ‘OTP: you ruined horses for me’ lmaooooooooo this is apparently the grand romance of the series
trail.content:
She barely spent time with him but he gets on a dragon without prompting, she never even offered Missandei a ride on Drogon. Dany… I can’t even blame her pussy for leading her astray because their sex scene was so bad. Girl what are you thinking?

Also ‘you ruined horses for me’ is so hilarious and cheesy and yuck but it’s the most romantic thing they have both said to each other. ‘OTP: you ruined horses for me’ lmaooooooooo this is apparently the grand romance of the series
